All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AdviceController
Defining a global exception handler
Category
A class representing the entity of the category
CategoryController
A web application controller that handles HTTP requests related to the Category entity.
CategoryDto
The class represents a data transfer object (DTO) for the Category entity.
CategoryMapper
The interface used for mapping (converting) objects between the Category and CategoryDto classes.
CategoryNotFoundException
A custom exception that is thrown if there is no category with the passed id in the database.
CategoryRepository
An interface that allows to perform various operations of the Category entity, such as saving, deleting, searching and updating, as well as receive data using various filters, for example, by ID or other attributes.
CategoryService
A service class that provides methods for performing CRUD operations on the category entity.
JpaCategoryTests
A set of tests for testing the methods of the Category service
JpaProductTests
A set of tests for testing the methods of the Product service
Product
A class representing the entity of the product
ProductController
A web application controller that handles HTTP requests related to the Product entity.
ProductDto
The class represents a data transfer object (DTO) for the Product entity.
ProductMapper
The interface used for mapping (converting) objects between the Product and ProductDto classes.
ProductNotFoundException
A custom exception that is thrown if there is no product with the passed UUID in the database.
ProductRepository
An interface that allows to perform various operations of the Product entity, such as saving, deleting, searching and updating, as well as receive data using various filters, for example, by ID or other attributes.
ProductService
A service class that provides methods for performing CRUD operations on the product entity.
ValidationException
A custom exception that can be thrown when errors occur during the data validation process.
ValidatorUtil
Used to perform object validation using a validator.
WarehouseApplication
The entry point for launching a Spring Boot-based application
WarehouseApplicationTests
